page.title: 13HOME LIFE (ii)
page.content: {Farmers' daily routine }is hard, with little time for leisure;e.g. rise at 6.45a.m. and see to the stock and yardwork before a large breakfast of bacon and eggs,toast and marmalade at 9; farm work till 1 p.m. lunch, which again is fried or a pie from the oven;tea is at 5.30,taken at table with substantial cold meats, bread and butter and cake.In summer work goes on till 10p.m. Cooking and heating is chiefly by solid fuel, electricity or oil. All houses get their water from springs or wells, and drainage is to septic tanks. Cats are the commonest pets _ many farms have 4 or 5; dogs, horses and ponies in plenty.Two families keep pet donkeys. No safety precautions exist; all rely on the local fire brigade,except a retired farmer who has a 3000 gallon tank of water in the barn "just in case".
